title: intro
content: intro

title: Type​
content: </> type Type = {@metatable: Symbol}

title: new​
content: </> Symbol.new(name: string) → () Creates a new Symbol, can also be called by using Symbol("foo")

title: Is​
content: </> Symbol.Is(object: any) → boolean Returns true if the object is a Symbol

title: ColorUtils
content: On this page ColorUtils

title: new​
content: </> Memoize.new(callbackFn: (K) → V) → (K) → V Creates a new memoized function, can also be created by calling the class itself. Recursive functions must use the this differently compared to normal functions. local Memoize = require("Memoize") --- Recursive impementation of fibonacci sequence: local function fib(n : number) : number if n < 2 then return n else return fib(n - 1) + fib(n - 2) end end fib = Memoize(fib) --- Normal impementation of fibonacci sequence: local fib = Memoize(function(n : number) : number local x, y, z = 0, 1, 1 for i = 2, n do x = y y = z z = x + y end end)

title: Errors
content: Type	Description"Memoize callback function must have one parameter."	Memoize will error is the returned function is called with more than one parameter.

title: Is​
content: </> Queue.Is(object: any) → boolean Returns true if the object is a Queue

title: new​
content: </> Queue.new( ...: T-- Items already in the queue ) → Type<T>
type Type<T> = { [number]: T, @metatable: Queue }  Creates a new queue.

title: enqueue​
content: </> Queue:enqueue( value: T-- The item to add to the queue ) → number-- The new size of the queue Adds a new item to the end of the queue and returns the new size.

title: dequeue​
content: </> Queue:dequeue() → T-- Item removed from the front of the queue Removes the first item from the queue and returns it.

title: Type<T>​
content: </> type Type<T> = { [number]: T, @metatable: Stack }

title: Is​
content: </> Stack.Is(object: any) → boolean Returns true if the object is a Stack

title: new​
content: </> Stack.new( ...: T-- Items already in the stack ) → () Creates a new stack object.

title: peak​
content: </> Stack:peak() → T-- The item at the top of the stack Returns the item at the top of the stack without removing it.

title: pop​
content: </> Stack:pop() → T-- The item at the top of the stack Removes the item at the top of the stack and returns it.

title: push​
content: </> Stack:push( value: T-- The item to add to the stack ) → number-- The new size of the stack Adds a new item to the top of the stack and returns the new size.

title: Type​
content: </> type Type = { _coroutine: thread, @metatable: Thread }

title: new​
content: </> Thread.new(callbackFn: functoin) → Type Creates a new thread from a function.

title: from​
content: </> Thread.from(thread: thread) → Type Creates a thread from a thread gotten from coroutine.running().

title: resume​
content: </> Thread:resume(...: any) → () Resumes the thread and returns true if the thread is still running.

title: getStatus​
content: </> Thread:getStatus() → "dead" | "running" | "suspended" | "normal" Returns the thread's status.

title: close​
content: </> Thread:close() → () Closes the thread

title: Item<T>​
content: </> interface Item<T> { Weight: : number-- The weight of an item Value: : T-- The value to be returned when using :GetItem() }

title: Items​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> WeightedRandom.Items: Array<Item<T>> A list of all items inside a weighted random object.

title: Weight​
content: This item is read only and cannot be modified. Read Only </> WeightedRandom.Weight: number The total weight of all items in a weighted random object.

title: Is​
content: </> WeightedRandom.Is(object: any) → boolean Returns true if the object is a WeightedRandom

title: new​
content: </> WeightedRandom.new( Objects: Array<Item<T>>, seed: number? ) → Type<T>
interface Type<T> { Items: Array<Item<T>> Weight: number }  Create a new WeightedRandom object from Array<Item> Objects.

title: getItem​
content: </> WeightedRandom:getItem() → T Returns a random item's Value from the object's Items property.

title: getItems​
content: </> WeightedRandom:getItems() → Array<Item<T>> A weighted random object's Items property.

title: getWeight​
content: </> WeightedRandom:getWeight() → number A weighted random object's Weight property.

title: e​
content: </> Math.e: number Euler's Number to the eigth decimal place (2.71828183)

title: cot​
content: </> Math.cot(x: number) → number Returns the cotangent of x.

title: coth​
content: </> Math.coth(x: number) → number Returns the hyperbolic cotangent of x.

title: csc​
content: </> Math.csc(x: number) → number Returns the cosecant of x.

title: csch​
content: </> Math.csch(x: number) → number Returns the hyperbolic cosecant of x.

title: factorial​
content: </> Math.factorial(n: number) → number Returns the factorial of n.

title: mean​
content: </> Math.mean(...: number) → number Returns the mean of the given numbers.

title: median​
content: </> Math.median(...: number) → number Returns the median of the given numbers.

title: nCr​
content: </> Math.nCr( n: number, r: number ) → number

title: nPr​
content: </> Math.nPr( n: number, r: number ) → number

title: root​
content: </> Math.root( radicand: number, index: number ) → number Returns the nth root of radicand. Equivalent to radicand ^ (1 / index).

title: sec​
content: </> Math.sec(x: number) → number Returns the secant of x.

title: sech​
content: </> Math.sech(x: number) → number Returns the hyperbolic secant of x.

title: summation​
content: </> Math.summation( i: number,-- index of summation n: number,-- upper limit of summation callbackFn: ( index: number, last: number ) → number-- function to call for each iteration ) → number Returns the summation of the function callbackFn(index, last) from i to n.

title: trunc​
content: </> Math.trunc(x: number) → number Removes the decimal places of x.
